title: Henry VIII and Anne Boleyn
description: A fast breakdown of Henry VIII and Anne Boleyn for builders.

hook.text: He broke with the Pope, created a new church, and split Christianity â€” all to marry one woman. Then he beheaded her.

buildup.text: Henry VIII wanted to annul his marriage to Catherine of Aragon. The Pope refused. Henry created his own church.

discovery.text: The Church of England was born from a love affair. Henry married Anne Boleyn in 1533, reshaping English religion.

twist.text: Anne failed to produce a male heir. Within three years, Henry had her executed on fabricated charges of treason.

climax.text: Henry's obsession with Anne Boleyn permanently severed England from Rome. A love affair shaped centuries of history.

punchline.text: Henry VIII created a church to marry Anne Boleyn. Then he killed her.
